Through his leadership, the District purchased a school bus so that children could enjoy ‚Äúbeing there‚Äù experiences, and he successfully managed proceeds from the sale of District land into 26+ years of programs for our students.
Please come tonight to the dedication of the Stephen J Waterman Wing at Lipman Middle School (built under his administration) to honor and thank Steve in person.

Join us as we participate in San Mateo County Office of Education's "One County, One Book" program in April, by reading the award-winning graphic novel "March: Book One", penned by social and human rights activist, Congressman John Lewis and Andrew Aydin drawn by renowned artist Nate Powell.

"March: Book One" is the first in a trilogy of illustrated memoirs that depict Lewis' journey from an Alabama sharecropper's farm, to segregated classrooms, his transformative meeting with Martin Luther King, Jr., and his passionate pleas for social justice and racial reforms as a United States Congressman.

If you are wondering what to do with your time after the little ones go back to school, may we offer a suggestion?

How about a part-time job as a Paraeducator? Or, if you need more flexibility, how about becoming a substitute teacher, substitute teacher's aide or substitute custodian? Even if you are not sure if you have the skills or qualifications, give us a call! We can help you through the process. We would love to have you on our team!

Of course, if you only have limited time available (we get it!) please sign up to volunteer in the classroom or outside of it. If every parent gave even just one hour a year, it would make a tremendous difference in our schools and in the lives of our students. Contact your school office for more information.

post_text: Thank you to the Brisbane Lions for providing free vision screening to Lipman students and staff today! The Lions Clubs International has been recognized worldwide for their work to improve sight and prevent blindness. Over the years, the Brisbane Lions Club has helped numerous BSD students receive critical eye exams and new glasses. If you have glasses at home that you no longer use, bring them to the school district office (we are open all summer) and we will get them to the Lions for recycling.

Interested in a career in teaching? How about a part-time job as a substitute teacher?

The San Mateo County Office of Education is holding a free Educator Recruitment Fair this Saturday, April 1, 10am to 3pm, at 101 Twin Dolphin Drive, Redwood City. Participants can visit booths hosted by local school districts, get advice on how to be a substitute or get certified to be a full-time teacher. There will even be a session on how to get hired!

Hope to see you there!

post_text: The Brisbane School District is excited to welcome 3 new members to the Board of Trustees: Lillian Markind and Jacque McLaughlin were elected to four-year terms, and Kima Hayuk was appointed to complete the two years remaining from Mr. Tingin's term. Continuing are Trustees Roxana Hui and Karen Lentz. The Board of Trustees normally meets on the 3rd Wednesday of every month; however, in order to meet state mandates, the December meeting will be early. Join us Dec. 7th at 6:00pm at Panorama School!

post_text: Last night, community members gathered before the regular board meeting to honor outgoing board members Dawn Cutler, Bob Dettmer and Leo Tingin. The three devoted a combined 26 years to their elected positions and many, many more outside of office. Their dedication to the District and its children is second to none. We thank them most earnestly for their leadership through the changing tides of public education and wish each of them the very best in their new pursuits.

The Board is confident that Mr. Collver will build upon the foundation of excellent programs already in place in the District. His qualifications and experience very closely match the Leadership Profile developed by the Board and the school community in the search process.
